sub_title: Design Org Designer: DesignOps, Design Process, Design Management, and Design Strategy.
summary:
Based on a formal and continuously updated training in Human Computer Interaction, I have accumulated 25 years of experience in many aspects of creating online, interactive applications such as stakeholder analysis, user research, service design, design strategy, experience design, conceptual design, planning, scoping, prioritizing, navigation design, functional design, UI design, and usability evaluation. I also have several years of experience in managing design teams and departments, product management, consulting, and mentoring.

I am an active member of international user experience, usability, and information architecture networks, and I actively maintain my network. I am a design process and DesignOps enthusiast.

I want to:
• Manage, mentor, and educate user experience professionals.
• Improve the quality of design by improving design processes, tools, methods, meetings, teams, and culture.
• Develop strategies and roadmaps for interactive product lines, illustrated with concept diagrams and sketches.
• Collect, analyse, discuss, and prioritise requirements for complex, interactive, and engaging applications.
• Design interactive applications using structured, user-centred design methods, tools and techniques.
• Work with, and learn from, professionals in other fields, and advance the field of user experience.

Specialties: User Experience Design, Information Architecture, Interaction Design, User Interface Design, UX Strategy, Concept Design, Experience Design, User Centered Design, Deliverables, Methods, Processes, Tools.

treasury_media.title: DesignOps integrates in-house design communities (EuroIA 2022)
treasury_media.description: In recent years, activities that focus on improving the organisation of design work have been re-labeled Design Operations (or DesignOps) and specialist roles and communities have popped up. People with this role focus on coordinating and executing initiatives that improve the conditions for designers, often in-house or at agencies. One aspect of DesignOps is improving the culture, craft, and collaboration between design practitioners. I present ways in which this happens at Miro and elsewhere.

projects.title: My Amsterdam
projects.description:
Mijn Amsterdam (“My Amsterdam”) was launched in November 2017 to provide citizens of Amsterdam with up-to-date information about the status of any processes they are undertaking with their local government. The collective statuses create a so-called integrated customer view that will also be used to allow civil servants to make better decisions for individual citizens as well as for the collective population.
The service aims to connect citizens and government, but also to connect many information systems (using APIs) and partial user profiles (by matching attributes) to create the integrated customer view and allow for better online service to Amsterdam's citizens and entrepreneurs.

projects.title: MyKLM, personalized intranet for KLM employees, combining content and tools
projects.description:
Working from KLM's Digital Studio, we redefined the sprawling and static intranet as a personalised, context-aware, data-driven, work-oriented tool.

After a Design Sprint was executed at the Digital Studio – KLM’s in-house design & development agency – an idea had been formed for a new intranet for KLM employees; now a team was needed to act on it. The Program Manager had already met with many stakeholders and found support for the idea but we needed to define the concept behind the user experience, the roadmap, the technical architecture, the front-end delivery system, and extend the design system component library with stunning visual elements.

The new intranet would have to support a wide variety of users, from flight attendants to engineers and HR staff. We proposed a concept where highlights of relevant content as well as the status of work-tools were shown as cards on a dashboard, with both types giving access to more details. This concept meant that other applications would slowly have to change technically (including provisioning APIs) and adopt design principles to create one seamless experience. We also merged our concept with a new search engine, chatbot, and account systems.

profile_positions.description:
I help design teams and their wider organizations improve the chances for good design to happen. I will help you analyze blockers, identify and prioritize solutions, and execute DesignOps initiatives that improve designer onboarding and retention, design planning and execution, design craft and culture.

Example projects:
- Lepaya (learning & development): mentored the design team and company leadership on design processes, personal growth, and design representation.
- OWASP (software security): worked with the team behind the OpenCRE.org software security standards database to identify and define user experience improvements.
profile_positions.title: DesignOps Consultant

profile_positions.description: At Miro, I was part of the Product Excellence team, where I supported designers, design leaders, and their peers in creating the circumstances in which good design can happen, amongst others by aligning ways of working and ways work was reviewed, by allowing for the tracking of work and its quality, and by building a shared culture.
profile_positions.title: Design Operations Manager

profile_positions.description: At ServiceNow’s in-house incubator NowX, I helped startup teams apply lean, agile, and user-centred methods to drive product design, and worked with NowX and the Experience Org leadership on creating the circumstances for good design to happen. I managed and mentored designers from Connected Ops (IoT), Process Optimization (process mining), Business Continuity Management (GRC), Robotic Process Automation (RPA), and our Industry teams for Telco, Banking, Healthcare, and Manufacturing.
profile_positions.title: Director of Product Design

profile_positions.description: During my onboarding, I was asked to temporarily take over the role of design manager for the team that designs our Performance Analytics & Reporting product. I supported that team by improving the relationships with product managers and developers by smoothening the release planning process, as well as by estimating, distributing, and reviewing the work of this international team of designers. My peers were the product managers, software development leads, QA leads, as well as fellow managers and directors.
profile_positions.title: Design Manager

profile_positions.description:
Working from KLM's Digital Studio, I redefined the sprawling and static intranet as a personalised, context-aware, data-driven, work-oriented tool.
Together with the Program Manager, we built a team of analysts, designers (interaction, visual, content), and developers (front-end & back-end) that operated in an agile/SAFe environment. We identified content sources and their providers, as well as work tools and their product managers, and worked on extracting the right information for each audience and presenting it in a personalized environment that followed (and extended) the design system for employees that was being set up.
profile_positions.title: (freelance) UX Strategist & Lead Designer

profile_positions.description: For the City of Amsterdam's Service Department, I defined the user needs, overall concept, design strategy, design principles, and interaction concept for a system that provides an integrated view on Amsterdam civilians and local companies, for use by themselves and civil servants when taking part in the delivery of current and future online services. This was done with a growing team that developed My Amsterdam in an agile environment, while coordinating with waterfall-oriented departments. I also contributed to tool selection, structuring, and populating the City's design system, as well as aligning our work with that of other big Dutch cities.
profile_positions.title: (freelance) Online Product Manager & Lead Designer

profile_positions.description: Defining the UX Roadmap for a part of SDL's suite of products, mostly focussed around the Tridion web-content management system. Ensuring a smooth transition of roadmap items into the agile design & development team. Managed 3 UX designers and helped define the UX Strategy practice.
profile_positions.title: UX Strategist & Design Manager

profile_positions.description: Managing (and performing) interaction design, information architecture and usability activities across the 4 European offices of Blast Radius. I worked with executives, account managers, project managers, front- and back-end developers, strategists, visual designers, business analysts, QA, and of course interaction designers on projects & programmes for Michelin, Nikon, NIVEA, and Sony.
profile_positions.title: Interaction Design Director

profile_positions.description: About twice a year I taught a 4-day Interaction Design course for which I created and maintained the materials. Teaching to small groups of smart professionals proved challenging, but rewarding.
profile_positions.title: Trainer Interaction Design

profile_positions.description: Building upon my experience in designing online, interactive systems for all kinds of organizations at several user experience agencies (the last one being Adaptive Path), plus the internal projects aimed at defining and improving the design processes there, I worked on product design and process design assignments in Europe.
profile_positions.title: Interaction Designer & Design Process Consultant

profile_positions.description:
For the 2 years that Adaptive Path had an office in Amsterdam, I worked on European and North-American projects; writing proposals, crafting online strategies, gathering and analyzing user/technical/business/content requirements, identifying business opportunities, defining experience design principles, and detailing, prototyping and evaluating the design.
Besides this work for clients, I improved materials for Adaptive Path's UX Intensive workshops and taught the Information Architecture and Interaction Design days. I also developed the Elements of User Experience training from scratch, and was co-host - with Jesse James Garrett - of the 2011 edition of Adaptive Path's UX Week.
profile_positions.title: Experience Designer & Project Lead

volunteer_experiences.description: The chapter lead is key to the success of a local chapter. I serve as a point person with DesignOps Assembly leadership and help develop and guide the local chapter while remaining aligned to the overall goals of DesignOps Assembly.

I am the Master of Ceremonies at these social events for the UX community. Since 2001, I look for hosts and presenters and announce and manage the attendee lists of the Amsterdam UX Cocktail Hours. Between 30 and 80 attendees can attend these evenings of learning, sharing, networking and socializing, and there's usually a waiting list.
In the past, we have held events on topics such as deliverables, agile, mobile, research, analytics, sketching, interactive marketing, the place of UX in organizations, and information architecture. Hosts have included Philips, TomTom, Info.nl, Mirabeau, User Intelligence, Booking.com, valsplat, Sapient Nitro, Adaptive Path, Wieden + Kennedy, Fabrique.

I was responsible for putting together the program for this biennial, design-and-business-oriented conference, which happened in 2006, 2008, 2010, and 2012. The events attracted around 500 attendees each from the business and UX communities in The Netherlands and surrounding countries. I focussed on attracting international keynote presenters as well as leading the program teams in identifying and selecting all presenters through moderating brainstorms, crafting call for papers, organizing review sessions and sending and receiving lots and lots of personalized email messages.
Member of the Board of Directors of the Information Architecture Institute (http://iainstitute.org), responsible for the development of a Local Group program and international developments.

For several years I was involved in activities of the Dutch local chapter of ACM SIGCHI (SIGCHI.NL and later CHI Nederland). From 2000-2002, I was a Board Member, responsible for Online Infrastructure.
